data.q: What do we remember on Anzac Day?
data.a: The landing of the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps at Gallipoli, Turkey
data.b: The arrival of the first free settlers from Great Britain
data.c: The landing of the First Fleet at Sydney Cove

data.q: What are the colours of the Australian Aboriginal Flag?
data.b: Green, white and black
data.c: Blue, white and green

data.q: Which official symbol of Australia identifies Commonwealth property?
data.b: Australia's national flower
data.c: Commonwealth Coat of Arms

data.q: Which of these statements about Australia's system of government is correct?
data.a: The Queen of Australia chooses people to form the Australian Parliament
data.b: The government is elected by the people
data.c: The Prime Minister chooses our Members of Parliament

data.q: Which of these is an example of freedom of speech?
data.a: People can peacefully protest against government decisions
data.b: Men and women are treated equally in a court of law
data.c: Australians are free to not follow a religion

data.q: Which of these statements about government in Australia is correct?
data.a: The government does not allow some religions
data.b: Government in Australia is secular
data.c: Religious laws are passed by parliament

data.q: Which of these is an example of equality in Australia?
data.b: Men and women have the same rights
data.c: Everyone belongs to the same political party

data.q: Which of these is a responsibility of Australian citizens aged 18 years or over?
data.b: To vote in elections
data.c: To have a current Australian passport

data.q: Which of these is a responsibility of Australian citizens aged 18 years or over?
data.b: To carry a passport at all times
data.c: To serve on a jury if called to do so

data.q: Which of these statements about passports is correct?
data.a: Australian citizens can apply for an Australian passport
data.b: Permanent residents can hold an Australian passport
data.c: Australian citizens need a passport and visa to return to Australia

data.q: Which of these statements about voting in Australian elections is correct?
data.a: People are free and safe to vote for any candidate
data.b: Voting is by a show of hands
data.c: People must write their name on their vote

data.q: What happened in Australia on 1 January 1901?
data.a: The Australian Constitution was changed by a referendum
data.b: The Australian Constitution came into effect
data.c: The Australian and New Zealand Army Corps was formed

data.q: What is the name of the legal document that sets out the rules for the government of Australia?
data.b: The Australian Commonwealth
data.c: The Australian Constitution

data.q: What is a referendum?
data.a: A vote to change the government
data.b: A vote to change the Australian Constitution
data.c: . A vote to change the Prime Minister

data.q: Which arm of government has the power to interpret and apply laws?
data.b: Executive
data.c: Judicia

data.q: Which of these is a role of the Governor-General?
data.b: The signing of Bills passed by the Australian Parliament
data.c: The appointment of the Head of State

data.q: Which of these statements about state governments is correct?
data.a: All states have the same constitution
data.b: Each state has its own constitution
data.c: The states have no constitution

data.q: What is the name given to the party or coalition of parties with the second largest number of members in the House of?
data.b: The Opposition
data.c: The Senate

data.q: What is the name of a proposal to make a law in parliament?
data.b: Bill
data.c: Debate

data.q: Who maintains peace and order in Australia?
data.b: Police
data.c: Lawyers
